title: Development of Field-Applicable Strategies through Comparative Analysis of Chinese and Japanese Mathematics Teaching Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics education theory and basic pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Pedagogical competency development course for pre-service or in-service teachers, focusing on comparative analysis of applicability to adult learners' professional contexts

learning_goals: Learners can analyze structured teaching method differences in Chinese-Japanese mathematics classes across three core dimensions: lesson design, instructional delivery, and teacher-student interaction
Learners can propose two+ strategies for combining teaching method strengths/weaknesses derived from comparative case studies to fit field contexts
A lesson design framework that balances knowledge transmission efficiency and in-depth inquiry-based learning can be applied to actual teaching materials.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
